subject: RE: [junit] Need Info
msgSnippet: You can have any number of unit tests executed at any given times, especially after BUILD. When you change somebody else s code, not only your new tests will
messageBody:
You can have any number of unit tests executed at any given times,
especially after BUILD. When you change somebody else's code, not only your
new tests will run, also the old ones will, and you don't have to worry
about it. The engine won't forget to run a suite here and there and can run
virtually hands - free. You will simply look up a report in your mailbox,
every morning.

Best Regards,

Daniel

-----Original Message-----
From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com]On Behalf Of
Mamata V Hegde
Sent: Wednesday, May 11, 2005 8:40 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Need Info


Hi All,
I have a question
Could any one please answer for this ??

Why Do we go For Automation during Unit Testing?

Thanks,
Mamata
